result.execSummary:
The defendant Sterling L Soman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs)

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Prison time on Oconto County Case #15CF38

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must obtain his HSED/GED.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

The defendant must take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.

DOC is required to notify the Court within 120 days of the start of the defendant's probation to inform the Court of the status of the defendant's progress while on probation.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or community based  meeting per week.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid at the maximum allowable rate from any prison wages/funds/monies due the defendant and if not paid by the end of his prison term - the defendant must serve an additional 6 months/consecutive.

Same conditions as count #2 except no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Count #2 but consecutive to prison time on Oconto County Case #15CF38.
Concurrent with: Count #2 but consecutive to Forest County Case #19CM85

Costs to be paid at the maximum allowable rate from any prison wages/funds/monies due the defendant and if not paid by the end of his prison term - the defendant must serve an additional 6 months on each count/consecutive.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: 10:02 AM Defendant Sterling L Soman in court with attorney John Miller Carroll both appear by Zoom.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin appears by Zoom.   Court puts on the record that this matter is being heard via Zoom due to Covid 19 Pandemic, makes sure no parties have any objections to the matter being heard in this manner, matter is also being live streamed via You Tube.Soman does not object to proceeding in this matter, would like to proceed and waives his right to appear personally. Previously hearing the DOC recommendation had changed, court asked DOC agent to file an amended Revocation Summary, court will proceed without it. Carroll indicates he does have a copy of the amended revocation paperwork and received it a couple days after the last hearing. Carroll reads what the amended revocation paperwork says - supervisor confirms recommendation of one year in the county jail. Court questions if the counts would be concurrent or consecutive.  State is recomending on count 2 - 3.5 years in the WI Prison System with 1.5 years of initial confinement  and 2 years of extended supervision. On count 6 - 4 years in the WI Prison System with 2 years of initial confinement and 2 years of extended supervision, to run concurrent to each other but consecutive to misd. charges, believes 229 days credit, makes statement to why this is their recommendation and asks that defendant not be eligible for programming until his first year is served. Carroll makes statement, asks to follow DOC recommedation of one year in FC jail. Court puts on the record that the amended revocation paperwork was filed in 19CM85. Carroll puts on the record that defendant is also being revoked on that case and should have been on the court docket for today. Court reviews file. Seifert indicates the 19CM85 was an imposed and stayed sentence. Discussion between parties regarding credit, the imposed and stayed sentence, warrant for non-payment. Soman makes statement. Court has considered statement of counsel, defendant, considered DOC revocation paperwork, on count 2 - Imposes 3.5 years in the WI Prison System with 1.5 years of initial confinement and 2 years of extended supervision. Carroll interupts court to clairify an issue the court brought up. On count 6 - imposes 3.5 years in the WI Prison system couns 2 & 6 will be concurrent to each other but consecutive to the sentence in 19CM85, court also addresses warrant - commitment time will be consecutive to each sentence and encourages defendant to pay commitment order as soon as possilbe. In 15CF42 - unpaid fines to be taken from prison wages/accounts and at the maxium amount allowable. Any amounts not paid after sentence a commitment order may be imposed on each count. Appeal rights given. Does not make defendant eligible for any programming. Seifert questions credit. Carroll recommends 63 days in 19CM85 and 243 days on 15CF42. Discussion regarding credit. Court grants 63 days credit in count one only in 19CM85. In 15CF42 - gives 180 days credit.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 29, 2020 at 10:00 am.

10:06 AM Defendant Sterling L Soman in court with attorney John Miller Carroll.  Defendant Sterling L Soman in custody from Brown County Jail via video/Zoom.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court puts on the record that these matters are being conducted via Zoom due to the Covid 19 pandemic. All parties waive their right to appear in person and no one objects to appearing via Zoom. This matter is also being live streamed via You Tube. All parties have revocation paperwork. Carroll  makes slight change to the recommendation as stated in the revocation order and believes the PO Agent (Skallerud) is trying to electronically send something to the Judge in regards to that. Carroll is attempting to call Agent Skallerud. Seifert would object to the changes as stated by Carroll for stated reasons. Carroll would not have any objections to an adjourment to get the necessary paperwork. Seifert has no objections to an adjournment but asks why the late change. Carroll responds. PO Agent Ron Skallerud now appear via phone (10:12 AM). Court asks Skallerud about the new offer. Skallerud responds, the new recommendation was approved by his supervisor and apologies for the delay and states reasons for the delay, new recommendation from DOC is now 1 year in FC jail as opposed to the original offer of a bifurcated prison term. Seifert would be arguing for a prison term. Carroll responds. Court makes statement, considering adjourning the manner for stated reasons. Skallerud can file an amended report/summary in regards to the new recommendation. Court is ordering that PO Skallkerud file an amended revocation report/order and recommedation. Carroll has 225 days credit and Seifert has 229 days credit. Court has rescheduled this matter. Adjourned at 10:20 AM.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for April 29, 2020 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 15, 2020 at 10:00 am.
Update from DOC re: progress report that is required per JOC

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sterling L Soman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Sterling L Soman in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:01 PM. State - resolved - plead G to counts #1, #2 and #6 as alleged, remaining counts will be dismisses and read in; #1 - acknowledge 3 prior offenses - joint recommendatioon of 365 days in FC jail (to be served in prison system) - concurrent to sentence that he is currently serving in Dodge Correctional Institute, fine of $2135.00, 36 month DL suspension, 36 month IID, reimburse City of Crandon $35.00 blood draw fee, #2 & #6 - fine of $500.00 plus costs on each count, place on probation for 3 years, consecutive to any jail time he is currently serving, AODA and follow thru, $35.00 blood draw, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or entry into any bars, 300 hours of community service, take all meds as prescribed by medical provider/physicial, attend community self-help group, maintain/obtain full time employment/school. Joy and Soman agree. Soman pleads G to count #1 as alleged, G to count #2 as alleged, G to count #6 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in counts #3, #4 and #5. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, find the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Soman makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 1 year of incarceration - can be served concurrently with his current sentence in Dodge Correctional Institute (15CF38 - Oconto County Case) - good time allowed, $2135.00 fine - take bond posted - remainder due within 30 days/CO, revoke license for 36 months, AODA, reimburse City of Crandon for $35.00 - take bond posted first on this fine, IID on vehicle and DL for 3 years commencing upon issuance of valid DL; #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - concurrent to each other but consecutive to jail on Oconto County CAse #15CF38 that he is currently serving, fine of $500.00 plus costs on each count - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 300 hours of community service total, take all medications in the manner in which they are prescribed, attend at least one AA/NA or community service program each week, obtain GED, DOC is required to notify the Court within 120 days of the start of probation to inform Court of the status of the defendant's progress while on probation, submit DNA sample with surcharge assessed and explains expunction rights on that, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned. Called 14CF131 - current warrant for unpaid fines ($1647.50) - instructed to pay fine or still under committment order.

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court. Defendant is not in court in jail in another county.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:10 PM. State - has not filed writ and asks for adjournment.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Sterling L Soman in custody, in court with attorney Jeffery Joy appearing by telephone.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:09 p.m. State - upon belief that there will be waiver of the preliminary hearing, state has filed information, which mirrors complaint. Joy - waiver of preliminary hearing. Court - goes over waiver form with defendant and feels the defendant has freely and voluntairly waived his preliminary hearing, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Joy - proceed to ARGN, waives further reading of information, enters NG pleas to all counts. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Court sets cash bond at $1000.00 - no consumption of alcohol, no possession of any firearms. Joy objects to bond forfeiture of $750.00. Court finds good cause to not forfeit the $750.00 and orders cash bond at $1750.00 with same conditions as previously stated
